page.title: 14Farming in Rhos 2
page.content: tanker.The milk is sold to the milk Marketing board in Marchwiel,a few miles away,where it is made into cheese.Each cow produces between 251 and 451 per day. During the warm weather the cows are left in the pastures to graze.The cows eat grass supplemented by cow nuts.The grass is digested in their four stomachs.Water is available to the cows from their troughs.In winter the cows are kept in a shippon and are then fed on silage,meal and hay.The cows continue to produce milk throughout the winter. The most common breed of cows in this area is Fresian.These are easily recognised by their black and white markings.A few hereford cows are also to be found in this area.
